title: Champions League, rapid red cards and alligator attacks – Football Weekly Extra
text:
Max Rushden , Barry Glendenning , Nicky Bandini and Musa Okwonga discuss Chelsea flying high in Amsterdam, Oxlade-Chamberlain’s worldy, rapid red cards, superstitions and very, very, very obvious handballs

Join the conversation on Facebook, Twitter and email.

We start by discussing Chelsea’s 1-0 Champions League win at Ajax, with some small similarities and some huge differences between this and a win away at Atlético Madrid two years ago.

We cover the other English sides involved in the Champions League fixtures this week, who all had far easier rides than Frank Lampard’s side.

The Premier League is back this weekend - we discuss the big game between Liverpool and Spurs, talk rapid red cards, pitch-side swimming pools and alligator attacks.

Back on Monday.

PS: Football Weekly versus Science is sold out!

PPS: our Christmas special is the last opportunity to see Football Weekly Live in London this year, at Indigo at the O2. Max, Barry, Jonathan Wilson, Elis James - more info and tickets here.

PPPS: we are also returning to Leeds in December – Max, Lars Sivertsen, Jonathan Wilson plus one TBA, click here.

PPPPS: if you’re on the other side of the Irish Sea, come and see us in Dublin! Max and Barry plus two more in January – first date sold out, but get your tickets for the second date, while stocks last, here.
description: Max Rushden, Barry Glendenning, Nicky Bandini and Musa Okwonga discuss Chelsea flying high in Amsterdam, Oxlade-Chamberlain’s worldy, rapid red cards, superstitions and very, very, very obvious handballs
